title: 91/94/EEC: Commission Decision of 13 February 1991 approving an amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops submitted by the Kingdom of Belgium pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87 (only the French and Dutch versions are authentic)
header:
COMMISSION DECISION  of 13 February 1991  approving an amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops submitted by the Kingdom of Belgium pursuant to Council Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87  (Only the French and Dutch versions are authentic)   (91/94/EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 1
The amendment to the varietal conversion programme for hops, submitted pursuant to Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87 by the Kingdom of Belgium on 24 July 1990, is hereby approved. The main aspects of the programme as amended are given in the Annex  hereto.  Article 2
The Kingdom of Belgium shall inform the Commission every six months of progress in the programme.  Article 3
This Decision is addressed to the Kingdom of Belgium.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 13 February 1991. For the Commission
Ray MAC SHARRY
Member of the Commission   (1) OJ No L 284, 7. 10. 1987, p. 19. (2) OJ No L 367, 29. 12. 1990, p. 2. (3) OJ No L 365, 24. 12. 1987, p. 41. (4) OJ No L 41, 14. 2. 1991, p. 18. (5) OJ No L 334, 6. 12. 1988, p. 26. (6) OJ No L 234, 11. 8. 1989, p. 52.
ANNEX
1. List of producer groups covered by the programme
- Pacohop SV
- De Poperingse Hopproducenten Vereniging
- De Aalsterse Hopproducenten Vereniging
These groups are represented by Febelhop (association of producer groups).
2. Duration of programme
From 1988 to 1992. The last plantings must be carried out before 31 December 1992.
3. Areas covered by the programme
Pacohop SV:  39,37 ha  De Poperingse Hopproducenten Vereniging:  146,61 ha  De Aalsterse Hopproducenten Vereniging:  5,30 ha   Total:  191,29 ha.
4. Varieties to be planted and areas concerned
Aromatic varieties:
Hallertauer:  26,64 ha  Hersbrucker Spaet:  16,46 ha  Challenger:  8,83 ha   Total:  51,93 ha.
Super-alpha varieties (1):
Yeoman:  50,28 ha  Target:  89,08 ha   Total:  139,36 ha.
(1) Within the meaning of Article 2 of Regulation (EEC) No 2997/87 and Article 1 (3) of Regulation (EEC) No 3889/87.
